results.title: Countering sexism
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development, Sabina Baltrukomis, Julie Sheehan and Don Fitzsimmons
results.brief_description: A compilation tape of four programmes addressing various aspects of sex discrimination. The episodes highlight women working in the media, the importance of gender inclusive curriculum, girls and science and sexual harrassment in schools.

results.title: Counter attacks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Judo”.
Having learnt the many techniques and the various factors which influence the way these techniques are used, the next stop is to learn how they can be linked. There are two main linking techniques - defensive and offensively; defensive linkage is known as countering. Counter take several forms, the value of which will depend largely upon the attitude of the person using them. Specific counters demonstrated are osoto-gaeshi, uchi-mata-gaeshi, an ippon-seoi-counter, waki-gatame and speed counters.

results.title: Countdown sign
results.credit_line:
Edie Kurzer, Australia, 2020
Courtesy Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: When those glowing, yellow bulbs flashed on to spell out the word ‘Countdown’ it heralded the beginning of an Australian institution. The weekly music show hosted and helmed by Ian ‘Molly’ Meldrum launched the careers of international acts such as Madonna and Aussie acts like Olivia Newton-John, INXS, AC/DC, Kylie Minogue, Mental as Anything and countless more. Over the course of its 14 year run, it became a critical tastemaker for deciding what was and wasn’t cool. This much loved show was one of the few mainstream outlets for youth culture and essential viewing for audiences wanting to engage with popular culture and music.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

results.title: Countdown
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Seven Arts Productions, William Conrad and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: The space-race between the United States and the Soviet Union reaches new heights when the Russians employ plans to send cosmonaughts directly to the moon. In the desperate attempt to be first, NASA sends Lee (James Caan) in an old style Gemini probe on a make-shift mission after three weeks training: to land on the Moon, and then live there for a year until rescued by the Apollo crew. This wry absurdity, directed by Altman after a ten year absence from filmmaking, makes great viewing for it depicts the US government as the “bad guy” and contains several anti-Cold War gestures. Screenplay by Loring Mandel. Based on the book, “Countdown” by Hank Searl.

results.title: Count us in
results.brief_description: Tells the story of what happens to a person trained for and skilled in a job who loses one of their physical faculties. Shows how the disabled and handicapped can be re-trained for other jobs and rehabilitated as constructive members of society.

results.title: Count to ten
results.brief_description: A public relations film designed to teach people in public service who deal with the general public that they can maintain the goodwill of a customer even when they must stick to “company policy”.

results.title: Count Basie and friends 1943-1951
results.brief_description: Part of the Jazz Classic series, this video presents the wonderful music of Count Basie, his orchestra and his friends including Jimmy Rushing, The Delta Rhythm Boys (Carl Jones, Kelsey Pharr, Otho Lee Gaines, Traverse W. Crawford), and Louis Jordan and his Tympany Five. Uses archival film footage, excerpts, and a complete short film titled “Caldonia” (1945, 18 mins) starring Louis Jordan, Cab Calloway, Doc Cheatham, Milt Hinton, Raymond Kaalund, Ben Webster. There is no historical or biographical commentary or narration throughout the video - music only, including “Someone’s rocking my dream boat”, “St Louis Blues”, “Take me back, baby”, “Honey chile”, “Just a sittin’ and a rockin’” and many more. One can see and hear the beginnings of jive and the early roots of rock ‘n’ roll through the beat and rhythms contained in some of this fabulous music. Enjoy the experience. NB: Archival footage has been digitally restored.

results.title: Coulomb's law
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the inverse square relationship between electric force and distance and shows that electric force is directly proportional to charge.

results.title: Couldn't be fairer
results.creator_credit: O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers, British Broadcasting Corporation and Dennis O'Rourke
results.brief_description: This is a devastating account of the Aboriginal land rights battle in Queensland. It reveals white Australians at their most beer-sodden and hypocritical. O’Rourke has captured scenes showing how racism and vulgarity, are alive and thriving in the Australian heartland! The film includes interviews by Mick Miller, chairman of the Queensland Aboriginal Land Council, with Joh Bjelke-Peterson and Russ Hinze.
